snippet.textDisplay: I've been reading some of the directors cut responses and if y'all are truly of thinking to remove infusion I'd say that's an overall bad move. By doing this you're going to be forcing the community to play more seriously and reducing the overall enjoyability of the game. There isn't a solid way to get exotic weapons either, so that's going to ruin a big aspect of it. Most other mmo RPGs have generalized weapons (melee weapons for the most part in dark souls and then all insane and off the top weapons in borderlands) that just don't fit into the destiny sandbox. The sandbox as is is formulated to how a person plays allowing for people to have preferences. It allows player to say they want to keep a raid weapon they got and really like from 3 years ago or something. In a fps rpg like borderlands all the weapons are useful and the pvp aspect isn't as prominent compared to destiny's. If you want to add meaning to newer weapons increase the cost of infusion, don't remove it completely
snippet.textOriginal: I've been reading some of the directors cut responses and if y'all are truly of thinking to remove infusion I'd say that's an overall bad move. By doing this you're going to be forcing the community to play more seriously and reducing the overall enjoyability of the game. There isn't a solid way to get exotic weapons either, so that's going to ruin a big aspect of it. Most other mmo RPGs have generalized weapons (melee weapons for the most part in dark souls and then all insane and off the top weapons in borderlands) that just don't fit into the destiny sandbox. The sandbox as is is formulated to how a person plays allowing for people to have preferences. It allows player to say they want to keep a raid weapon they got and really like from 3 years ago or something. In a fps rpg like borderlands all the weapons are useful and the pvp aspect isn't as prominent compared to destiny's. If you want to add meaning to newer weapons increase the cost of infusion, don't remove it completely

snippet.textDisplay:
Please turn off light power.
The whole point of these trails is to be sweaty in a fair environment.
Forcing light level is just forcing players to work on there light level so you get more overall playtime from individual players who want to do trails without trying too hard, or so they don't get creamed by someone much higher light level.
It defeats the point of trails. I nearly left D2 because of iron banner and the amount of time i wasted in that because I have a job and can't grind light level like others. So I decided to ignore it until trails comes around to bring me back... And it's the same damn thing...
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: Are we all going to pretend that people like Bonnie Burton, who went from a tester to producer, have not had an impact on how bad Bungie has managed their updates? Are people like this the reason why this developer has the best track record of being the slowest to respond to feedback that, we, the community, have given for so long? Fuck, I am angry because I have been with Destiny 2 since year 1 and there are so many things that need to be fixed. So many quality of life issues that need to be fixed. I am not trying to call out a single person as the reason for this shit. I am trying to make it aware that it is absurd for so much time to pass and not see proper updates that have been requested TIME AND TIME again. It is outrageous.
snippet.textOriginal: Are we all going to pretend that people like Bonnie Burton, who went from a tester to producer, have not had an impact on how bad Bungie has managed their updates? Are people like this the reason why this developer has the best track record of being the slowest to respond to feedback that, we, the community, have given for so long? Fuck, I am angry because I have been with Destiny 2 since year 1 and there are so many things that need to be fixed. So many quality of life issues that need to be fixed. I am not trying to call out a single person as the reason for this shit. I am trying to make it aware that it is absurd for so much time to pass and not see proper updates that have been requested TIME AND TIME again. It is outrageous.

snippet.textDisplay: This stupid shit has gotten out of hand. Now you have to grind just to be on a level playing field inside of ToO. All just so you can turn around and grind again for the Trials gear, good play Bungie. This shit isn’t even a real competitive game because of how broken it is. That’s why Destiny 2 can’t even make top 10 on Twitch. There’s no balance aside from constantly tweaking weapon only to turn around and change it all again later.

snippet.textDisplay: 2:20 "We are in the play-test-lab everyday, playing trials, trying to get it just right. We've been working to balance, uh you know, the abilities, the sub-classes, the weapons, the armor, to make sure it is as fun and as fair as possible." Ah, yes! I COMPLETELY believe you tested the difference between 1050 light, 1040 light, 1030 light, and 1020 light! Yes! Of course! I completely believe that you guys expect us to quit our day jobs, and shit n piss in a bucket to truly dedicate ourselves to destiny 24/7 so when a 1040 decides to match make in my fucking region he better expect his Beloved to take 2 hits to the head just to kill me! AHAHHAHAHAHHA YES I LOVE THIS GRIND YES
snippet.textOriginal: 2:20 "We are in the play-test-lab everyday, playing trials, trying to get it *just right.* We've been working to balance, uh you know, the abilities, the sub-classes, the weapons, the armor, to make sure it is as fun and as *fair* as possible." Ah, yes! I *COMPLETELY* believe you tested the difference between 1050 light, 1040 light, 1030 light, and 1020 light! Yes! Of course! I completely believe that you guys expect us to quit our day jobs, and shit n piss in a bucket to truly dedicate ourselves to destiny 24/7 so when a 1040 decides to match make in my fucking region he better expect his Beloved to take 2 hits to the head just to kill me! snippet.textDisplay:
To all the people complaining about light level and artifacts:
It’s to make money. They don’t care about us. When people see that they are losing in trails due to power level 1050 guys, they’ll do whatever it takes to get there, which is, you guessed it, another expansion. So, more money in Bungie’s pockets.

snippet.textDisplay: I think revamping legendary weapons and retiring current ones is a good idea. The same was done in D1 and it allowed other weapons to standout instead of stagnation of the current loot pool. As for the artifact being added to Trial's that would be a big no. It wouldn't be fair to people who have responsibilities outside of Destiny 2 meaning they can't grind all day everyday for highest levels. I haven't enjoyed the seasons due to only grinding bounties and higher light activity. No focus on new or better loot in nightfall or strike's like D1 had. I don't think max light should be locked behind harder PVE activities other than the Raid.
snippet.textOriginal: I think revamping legendary weapons and retiring current ones is a good idea. The same was done in D1 and it allowed other weapons to standout instead of stagnation of the current loot pool. As for the artifact being added to Trial's that would be a big no. It wouldn't be fair to people who have responsibilities outside of Destiny 2 meaning they can't grind all day everyday for highest levels. I haven't enjoyed the seasons due to only grinding bounties and higher light activity. No focus on new or better loot in nightfall or strike's like D1 had. I don't think max light should be locked behind harder PVE activities other than the Raid.

snippet.textDisplay: ..we will see how it plays out. had fun going to the lighthouse several times in d1. not so much having fun with pvp on d2 though with 6v6 with always "that guardian"with a Johtunn/ telesto/ Nova Bomb spam glich in the past/ laser tag trace rifle and so on.In my opinion on consoles snipers are not my secundary weapon anymore(flinch!) in combo with eg last word if you can get a kill so much easier in another way. also the nerf on luna's howl did not do much good on the whole d2 pvp experience . And not to mention the loading times on ps4. all the error codes, it is a complete jungle of animals passing by from time to time.
